headline: Citi and Bank of Shanghai Launch First-of-Its-Kind Payments Solution for International Travelers in China
summary: SHANGHAI, November 12, 2024--Today, Citi (NYSE: C) and Bank of Shanghai launched a first-of-its-kind payments solution on Bank of Shanghai’s TourCard. The TourCard aims to provide international travelers a straightforward, cost-efficient and more streamlined Chinese yuan renminbi (CNY) payment journey while traveling in China.

headline: Tradeweb Collaborates With Tokyo Stock Exchange, Expands Market Share
summary: TW joins forces with the Tokyo Stock Exchange to enhance liquidity for its buy-side clients in Japanese ETFs. This builds on the company's existing offerings.

summary: Wall Street is preparing for higher bonuses for the first time since 2021, with underwriters and traders getting the biggest pay boosts for 2024 performance.

headline: The Outsider Trying to Restore Citi to Investment-Banking Glory
summary: The man charged with reviving  Citigroup  reputation as an investment bank is setting his sights on the buyout kings.  Vis Raghavan, Citi’s new banking head, wants his dealmakers to advise on and finance more private-equity deals, bringing in more fees to a group that has punched below its weight for more than a decade.  Citi earned $2.7 billion in investment-banking fees last year.
